intro: Kohautia raphidophylla, commonly known as the glassy fern, is a unique species native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its delicate, translucent fronds that resemble glass, giving it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. Its spores are produced in small, clustered structures called sori, which are located on the underside of the fronds. Kohautia raphidophylla is a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native habitat.
